qas.question: When where the Eclogues likely published?
What were Octavian' s agent d'affaires called?
Which leading literary figure often mentioned Virgin in his poetry?
Who invited Virgil to become part of the circle of Maecenas?
Which Roman figure of the time was the most prolific writer?
What work was Virgil the most proud of?
How many poems did Horace write?

context: Sometime after the publication of the Eclogues (probably <a1_0>before <b8_0>37<b8_0/> BC<a1_0/>), Virgil became part of the circle of <a2_0>Maecenas<a2_0/>, Octavian's capable agent d'affaires who sought to counter sympathy for Antony among the leading families by rallying Roman literary figures to Octavian's side. Virgil came to know many of the other leading literary figures of the time, including <a3_0><b4_0>Horace<b4_0/><a3_0/>, in whose <b6_0>poetry<b6_0/> he is often mentioned, and <a0_0><b5_0>Varius Rufus<b5_0/><a0_0/>, who later helped finish <b7_0>the Aeneid<b7_0/>.
